titleStmt.title: (Copy of) list of priests and temple inventory

msContents.summary: The presbyter of the Soknobraisis priests in Bakchias gives the list of priests and temple inventory.

msItem.note: Related to P. Fouad 186-189 (ed. A. Bataille, Un nouveau dieu Ä Bacchias, –tudes de papyrologie, 4, 1938, p. 197-205)

origin.origPlace: Bakchias, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

div.ab: (from) ... presbyter of the priests of Sok[nobraisis, the great god of the] famous temples [in the village of Bakchias. List] of priests and temple inventory for the current year which is the eleventh year of our lord Aurelius [Antoninus Caesar.] Among the things [in the temple there are: a] gilded [wooden shrine for Soknokonnis] and [a gilded wooden shrine for] Pnepheros, [fifteen] trumpet-shaped bronze [lampstands, ten bronze cups,] one bronze censer, [two wooden] pipes, [each with] five bronze [bands,] two [gilded] wooden platters, one bronze vessel. Among the priests, [who have, one by one, been adjudged to pay twelve drachmae and] who have, according to order, paid the the eiskritikon are: Peteãsis, forty-one years old, ... [Psenam]oun[is, ... Psen]amou[nis

listBibl.bibl: P.Bacch. 3 SB VI 9337 P.Lund. III 6 BL V, 64; TM 14155; Wilcken, U., Archiv fír Papyrusforschung 13 (1939) p. 233; Hombert, M., Chronique d'–gypt 14, 1939, p. 400-401; Schmidt, K. F. W., Philologische Wochenschrift (Jahrgang) 60 (No 45/48), 1940, c. 608-611; van Groningen, B. A., Museum, Maandblad voor Philologie en Geschiedenis, 47, 1940, c. 168
